page.title: 06THE MACAULAY INSTITUTE
page.content: The town council went bankrupt after building Union St. and had to sell land. A piece was bought by Mr.MacAulay in 1820 to build a house. His house and land were subsequently acquired by the Dept. of Ag.& Fish who introduced soil research.This includes work on soil, soil maps,soil fertility and soil analysis.They give data about farmers' land and the Coll. of Agri. advises the farmers. The institute mainly works with Scottish soils. Overseas visitors come for training. There are 120 staff, about 80 Science grads. They have 50 acres for experimental farming. The 100 roomed building costs Â£3.5M pa. 70% is spent on staff and 25% on equipment.The DAF gives the money by Grant, providing research is published in Scientific journals.They have a lot of computers.
